{{Infobox Network Adapter |image1 = |image1_size = |caption = Dual Band AC580 Wireless Mini USB Adapter |caption2 = Linksys Mini AC580 Adapter |pp = http://www.linksys.com/us/p/P-AE6000/ |sp = http://support.linksys.com/us/support-product?pid=01t80000003KqWBAA0 |dl = |wikidevi = |wikipedia = |brand = Linksys |model = AE6000 |submodelappend = |submodel = |revision = v1.0 |subrevision = |model_part_num = |page_start_date = 01/08/2013 |page_start_origon = https://wikidevi.com/wiki/Linksys_AE6000 |sernum = |wlclass = AC600 |series = |if = USB |if_bus_version = 2.0 |ifconnector = Male A |formfactor = micro dongle |vendor_id = 13b1 |device_id = 003e |subvendor_id = |subdevice_id = |id_string = |windosid = |fcc_id = Q87-AE6000 |icid = 3839A-AE6000 |boardid = |ecc_id = |oui = C8:D7:19 |chip1 = MediaTek;MT7610U; |chip2 = |chip3 = |chip4 = |antconn = |antenna = |txchains = 1 |rxchains = 1 |sstreams = 1 |wirelessstand = IEEE 802.11a/b/g/n/ac |802.11ac = 433 |802.11n = 150/150 |802.11g = 54 |802.11b = 11 |802.11a = 54 |wififreq = 2.4 or 5 |receive_sens = |transmit_power = |linuxdriv = |windriv = |is_manuf = No |manuf = Wistron NeWeb |manuf_model = |manuf_rev = |addchip = |flags = DFS, |802dot11_protocols = abgn+ac |accessible_UART = No |accessible_JTAG = |category = |availability = |eoldate = |fccapprovdate = 02/19/2013 |estreldate = |estprice = |upc = |ean = |dx_sku = |newegg = N82E16833124495 |asin = B00B9Q3EE8 |asin_country = |asin2 = |asin_country2 = |countrymanuf = China |powledcolor = |connactled = |spdledcolor = |leddupcolor = |dimmin = |weight = }}{{TIDTOC|adapter}} ==Overview== "Manufactured for CISCO", the '''Cisco''' logo, "48DNUR25.SGD", and "2012.11.12 AE6000" is silkscreened on the board in the FCC photos. FCC photos show the device using a '''MediaTek''' MT7610U (MT7610UN). :The FCC test report specifies the test program as '''MT76xxU.exe'''. :The Wistron NeWeb part is referenced as DNUR-C4 on the FCC label. It appears to be using an [http://www.rfmd.com/CS/Documents/RFFM4501DS.pdf '''RFMD''' RFFM4501 802.11abgn/ac WLAN FEM] (marked w/ logo, 4501, and KFHU). {{WiFiCert|WFA17763|01/21/2013}} ==Links of Interest== *[http://www.flickr.com/photos/cisconordics/8356901637/in/photostream/ Images in ''Cisco Linksys'' Nordics' flickr] * [http://home.cisco.com/en-us/press/releases/release_linksys_01072013 Announced in ''Cisco'' press release (01/07/2013)] * [http://www.engadget.com/2013/01/07/linksys-reveals-a-trio-of-802-11ac-wifi-routers-with-beamforming/ Via '''EnGadget'''] * [http://www.smallnetbuilder.com/other/ces-2013/31989-cisco-linksys-ces-2013-announcements ''Cisco-Linksys CES 2013 announcements'' on '''SmallNetBuilder'''] ==Notes== ===rt2800usb (partial, as the device is unsupported) chip info dump=== 
ieee80211 phy22: rt2800_probe_rt: Error 
- Invalid RT chipset 0x7650, rev 2000 detected
